properties.title: Azure Virtual Desktop - Session Host Replacer Deployment

elements.name: sessionHostsCount
elements.label: Target Session Host Count
elements.toolTip: The target number of session hosts in the host pool.

elements.name: sessionHostNamePrefix
elements.label: Session Host Name Prefix
elements.toolTip: The prefix for the session host names. The session host names will be in the format (prefix)-(number). Make sure this produces a unique value across all device names in your environment. Try selecting a prefix that helps you identify the host pool such as AVDHP01 for example so the session hosts will be named AVDHP01-01, AVDHP01-02 and so on.

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid name less than 12 characters long to allow for the 3 character suffix (eg. prefix-01).

elements.name: UseUserAssignedManagedIdentity
elements.label: Use User Assigned Managed Identity
elements.toolTip: [Recommended] IF enabled, The Session Host Replacer will use the selected Identity to take actions. Otherwise System Identity (MSI) is used.

options.text: When using a User Assigned Managed Identity, make sure the identity has the needed permissions in Azure and Entra. Follow the link for more info.

elements.name: EnableMonitoring
elements.label: Enable Monitoring
elements.toolTip: [Recommended] If enabled, the session host replacer will use App Insights and Log Analytics to collect metrics and logs.

elements.name: UseExistingLAW
elements.label: Select existing Log Analytics Workspace
elements.toolTip: If enabled, the session host replacer will use the selected Log Analytics Workspace. If disabled, the session host replacer will create a new Log Analytics Workspace.

options.text: AVD session host replacer Portal UI Version: v0.2.8-beta.10

elements.name: SessionHostsRegion
elements.label: Session Hosts Region
elements.toolTip: Select region to deploy session hosts.

elements.name: AvailabilityZones
elements.label: Availability Zones
elements.toolTip: Select Availability Zones for the session hosts. Make sure the selected size is available in the selected zones. Session hosts will be deployed across the zones.

elements.name: AcceleratedNetworking
elements.label: Enable accelerated networking
elements.toolTip: Enables low latency and high throughput on the network interface.

elements.name: SessionHostDiskType
elements.label: OS Disk type
elements.toolTip: Select session host disk type to host the OS.

elements.name: dropDownMarketPlaceImage
elements.label: Select a Marketplace Image
elements.toolTip: Marketplace images are updated on monthly basis. The Session Host Replacer will replace the session hosts when a new image is available.

options.text: The system identity of the Session Host Replacer function is assigned the 'Desktop Virtualization Virtual Machine Contributor' role against the subscription. If the Image Definition is in a different subscription, please make sure you manually assign the permission post deployment.

elements.name: SecurityType
elements.label: Security type
elements.toolTip: Choose a type of security that matches your needs: Standard includes basic protections at no additional cost. Trusted launch virtual machines provide additional security features on Gen2 virtual machines to protect against persistent and advanced attacks.

elements.name: SecureBootEnabled
elements.label: Enable secure boot
elements.toolTip: Secure boot helps protect your VMs against boot kits, rootkits, and kernel-level malware.

elements.name: TpmEnabled
elements.label: Enable vTPM
elements.toolTip: Virtual Trusted Platform Module (vTPM) is TPM2.0 compliant and validates your VM boot integrity apart from securely storing keys and secrets.

elements.name: SubnetId
elements.label: Subnet ID
elements.placeholder: Add resource id of subnet in the same region as the Session Hosts

validations.message: Invalid Subnet Resource ID. Make sure it ends with /subnets/SubnetName

elements.name: IdentityServiceProvider
elements.label: Identity service provider
elements.toolTip: Identity service provider (Active Directory or EntraDS) that already exist and will be used for Azure Virtual Desktop.

options.text: When the VMs are Entra Joined, session host replacer will attempt to delete its device object from Entra ID. This requires additional permissions to be granted to the service principal used by session host replacer. Please refer to the documentation for more information.

elements.name: IntuneEnrollment
elements.label: Intune enrollment
elements.toolTip: If Intune is configured in your Microsoft Entra ID tenant, you can choose to have the VM automatically enrolled during the deployment by selecting this box. Session Host Replacer will delete the device from Intune during replacement.

elements.name: ADDomainJoinUserName
elements.label: User principal name
elements.toolTip: Provide username with permissions to join session host to the domain.

elements.name: ADJoinUserPassword
elements.toolTip: Provide password for domain join account. This will be stored in a new Azure Key Vault.

elements.name: ADOUPath
elements.label: Custom OU path (Optional)
elements.toolTip: Provide OU where to locate session hosts, if not provided session hosts will be placed on the default (computers) OU.

elements.name: LocalAdminUsername
elements.label: Local Administrator Username
elements.toolTip: Provide username for session host local admin account. Administrator can't be used as username, it is reserved by the system. The password is randomly generated at deployment time.

constraints.validationMessage: This username can't be used, it is a reserved word.

elements.name: _Tag_IncludeInAutomation
elements.label: Include in Automation Tag Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the tag to use to determine if an existing session host should be included in the automation. After deployment, if the tag is present and set to 'true', the session host will be included. If the tag is not present or set to 'false', the session host will be excluded.

elements.name: _Tag_DeployTimestamp
elements.label: Deploy Timestamp Tag Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the tag to use to determine when the session host was deployed. This is updated by the session host replacer function on new session hosts. After deployment, you can edit the value of this tag to force replace a VM.

elements.name: _Tag_PendingDrainTimestamp
elements.label: Pending Drain Timestamp Tag Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the tag to use to determine when the session host was marked for drain. This is updated by the session host replacer function on hosts pending deletion.

elements.name: _Tag_ScalingPlanExclusionTag
elements.label: Scaling Plan Exclusion Tag Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the tag session host replacer will set to exclude a session host from scaling plans actions.

elements.name: _TargetVMAgeDays
elements.label: Target VM Age (Days)
elements.toolTip: The maximum age of a VM in days before it is replaced. This is compared to the value of the Deploy Timestamp Tag.

elements.name: _DrainGracePeriodHours
elements.label: Drain Grace Period (Hours)
elements.toolTip: The number of hours to wait after marking a VM for drain before deleting it. This is to allow users to finish their sessions before the VM is deleted.

elements.name: _FixSessionHostTags
elements.label: Fix Existing Session Host Tags
elements.toolTip: If enabled, the session host replacer will fix the tags on existing session hosts or if tags are mistakenly deleted. The tag values will NOT allow deletion of existing session hosts and must be changed post deployment. This is useful if you are deploying a new session host replacer to an existing host pool.

elements.name: _SHRDeploymentPrefix
elements.label: Deployment Prefix
elements.toolTip: The prefix of the deployment created in the session hosts resource group when replacement VMs are deploying. This is used to track running and failed deployments.

elements.name: _AllowDownsizing
elements.label: Allow Downsizing
elements.toolTip: If enabled, the session host replacer will delete older session hosts when the total number of good hosts is higher than target session host number.

elements.name: _SessionHostInstanceNumberPadding
elements.label: Session Host VM Name Padding
elements.toolTip: The number of digits to pad the session host instance number with. For example, if the value is 3, the session host names will be in the format <prefix>-001.

elements.name: _ReplaceSessionHostOnNewImageVersion
elements.label: Replace Session Hosts On New Image Version
elements.toolTip: (Recommended) If enabled, the session host replacer will replace session hosts when a new image version is available. This works for both marketplace and custom images. If disabled, the session host replacer will only replace session hosts when the VM age is greater than the target VM age.

elements.name: _ReplaceSessionHostOnNewImageVersionDelayDays
elements.label: Replace on New Image Version Delay (Days)
elements.toolTip: The number of days to wait after a new image is available before replacing session hosts. This is to allow time for the image to be tested before replacing session hosts.

elements.name: _VMNamesTemplateParameterName
elements.label: VM Names Template Parameter Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the parameter in the template that specifies the VM Names array.

elements.name: _SessionHostResourceGroupName
elements.label: Session Hosts Resource Group Name
elements.placeholder: Same As Host Pool Resource Group
elements.toolTip: Leave this empty to deploy to same resource group as the host pool.
